title: North Star of Herschel Island - The Last Canadian Arctic Fur Trading Ship.
description: This book tells the true 76 year history of Canada's Arctic tall ship from her beginning as an Inuit owned fur trading ship; her role in Canadian Arctic sovereignty during the Cold War; sail-training with Inuit; surveying the B.C./Alaska boundary; a Cambridge University scientific charter to search for mermaids and her present role as an International Good Will Ambassador in tall ship festivals. The author traveled to the high Arctic and lived with Inuit elders who shared their memories and private photo albums with him.
author: R. Bruce Macdonald
